name: AnvilInventory
description: The AnvilInventory class provides specialized access to Minecraft's anvil interface, allowing scripts to interact with anvil operations such as renaming items, repairing items, and combining enchantments.
overview:
This class extends the base `Inventory` class and adds anvil-specific functionality for managing the rename field, level costs, and input/output slots.

Anvils in Minecraft have three main slots:
- **Left Input (Slot 0):** The item to be renamed, repaired, or enchanted
- **Right Input (Slot 1):** The sacrifice material for repairing or enchanting
- **Output (Slot 2):** The resulting item after applying the anvil operation

You typically get `AnvilInventory` instances when the player has an anvil screen open via `Inventory.create()`.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Gets the current text entered in the anvil's rename field.

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the text in the anvil's rename field.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name to set for the item.

methods.name: getLevelCost
methods.description: Gets the current experience level cost required to perform the anvil operation.

methods.name: getItemRepairCost
methods.description: Gets the base repair cost penalty associated with the item.

methods.name: getMaximumLevelCost
methods.description: Gets the maximum level cost allowed by the anvil (usually 40) before it displays 'Too Expensive'.

methods.name: getLeftInput
methods.description: Gets the item currently in the left input slot (Slot 0).

methods.name: getRightInput
methods.description: Gets the item currently in the right input slot (Slot 1).

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Gets the resulting item in the output slot (Slot 2).
